data.text: @DeepBreathPeace @s22bos21 @USMortality Death by pneumonia with C19+ would clearly be a C19 death.   If a hospital doesn’t designate C19 as the primary cause for a patient who had diabetes + C19, I would think there was not a clear indication that there was any severe C19 symptoms.

@DeepBreathPeace @s22bos21 @USMortality You are trying to provide evidence that no extra $ was given by government for COVID-19 classification and when trying to back that up that idea, you aren’t able to provide any evidence.

@DeepBreathPeace @s22bos21 @USMortality The USA Today article affirms hospitals received money from government by classifying a patient as having COVID-19.  It made no representation that such money was only limited to patients without heath insurance reimbursement.

@DeepBreathPeace @s22bos21 @USMortality You started this thread by saying the number doesn’t seem right about the numbers for cause of death by COVID-19 as the *primary* cause.  Those would mostly be from COVID pneumonia.
@MattRandolphLee @s22bos21 @USMortality What was in the Twitter link said 39 k for Coronavirus and respirator in Medicaid. It didn’t say that was in excess of anything else

@DeepBreathPeace @s22bos21 @USMortality Perhaps you are assuming hospitals did not get insurance reimbursement in addition to $39K?  USA Today article shows multiple fact checkers have debunked your view that hospitals did not receive extra $ for C19.
@MattRandolphLee @s22bos21 @USMortality Considering my insurance paid over 20k for my hysterectomy 39k for ventilator seems very low
@MattRandolphLee @s22bos21 @USMortality I do not think individual hospitals are going to release that. That’s proprietary

@MattRandolphLee @s22bos21 @USMortality Sounds like there’s no point in continuing this conversation as it sounds like you’re saying if someone had diabetes AND Covid you wouldn’t count that as a Covid death. Or Covid and pneumonia caused by Covid.

@DeepBreathPeace @s22bos21 @USMortality You wrote “It’s talking about what the hospital was making previous years va that year.”

And it does not show that for any hospital.
